channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024072124
item.description:
Report X-2024072124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver placed a code 10 on the package and had it removed from the van. QA admin placed a code 39 on it, put the package in a lined tote, and brought it to the damage area. Two of four bottles leaked small amounts due to loose caps.

item.title: Report X-2024071634
item.description:
Report X-2024071634

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-04
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No-spill unprocessed hazmat. Package contains two bottles of UN1992 and two bottles of UN1993. The package is marked with UN1992, Flammable liquids, toxic, n.o.s. (Methanol) but has no diamond or LQ mark. It does not have shipping papers, certification, or a hazmat barcode. A sticky liquid from an outside source leaked onto the box, but all contents are undamaged.

item.title: Report E-2024070660
item.description:
Report E-2024070660

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-07
  • City: NEW BRIGHTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ADVANTAGE MANAGEMENT GROUP, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 317500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on Route 88 near New Brighton, Minnesota and collided with another vehicle that was traveling westbound on Route 19. The loading lines on the KAG Energy, LLC trailer were damaged. This allowed approximately 2800 gallons of gasoline to be released. A portion of the spilled gasoline was able to impact a nearby stream. Baywest Environmental continues to remediate the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024071957
item.description:
Report X-2024071957

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLYEE WAS MOVING IRREGULARS WHEN ATTEMPTING TO MOVE SAID PACKAGE AND FOUND PACKAGE LEAKING. CALLED REWRAP AND RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PROPER PPE ON. FOUND THE CLOUSRE LEAKED OUT FLUID. PLACED SAID PACKAGE INTO SPILL TRAY, CLEANED UP AY DEBRIS AND RETURNED TO DMP FOR PORCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024070568
item.description:
Report E-2024070568

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 275-gallon poly tote due to a puncture from a sharp object. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized all cleanup debris. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070498
item.description:
Report E-2024070498

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 15, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN2014 were damaged due to a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted material was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.
